trans-unit.source: Service-side authorization of users in a .NET backend mobile service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Service-side authorization of users in a .NET backend mobile service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to restrict access for authorize users in a .NET backend mobile service
trans-unit.target: Learn how to restrict access for authorize users in a .NET backend mobile service

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use server-side logic to authorize users.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use server-side logic to authorize users.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you modify table controllers, filter queries based on user IDs, and give users access to only their own data.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you modify table controllers, filter queries based on user IDs, and give users access to only their own data.

trans-unit.source: Filtering a user's query results by the user ID is the most basic form of authorization.
trans-unit.target: Filtering a user's query results by the user ID is the most basic form of authorization.

trans-unit.source: Depending on your specific scenario, you might also want to create Users or Roles tables to track more detailed user authorization information, such as which endpoints a given user is permitted to access.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your specific scenario, you might also want to create Users or Roles tables to track more detailed user authorization information, such as which endpoints a given user is permitted to access.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services Quick Start and builds on the [Add Authentication to Existing Mobile Services App] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services Quick Start and builds on the [Add Authentication to Existing Mobile Services App] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Please complete [Add Authentication to Existing Mobile Services App] first.
trans-unit.target: Please complete [Add Authentication to Existing Mobile Services App] first.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open your mobile project, expand the DataObjects folder, and open TodoItem.cs.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open your mobile project, expand the DataObjects folder, and open TodoItem.cs.

trans-unit.source: The TodoItem class defines the data object, and you need to add a UserId property to use for filtering.
trans-unit.target: The TodoItem class defines the data object, and you need to add a UserId property to use for filtering.

trans-unit.source: Add the following new UserId property to the TodoItem class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following new UserId property to the TodoItem class:

trans-unit.source: To make this data model change and maintain existing data in the database, you must use <linkText>Code First Migrations</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To make this data model change and maintain existing data in the database, you must use <linkText>Code First Migrations</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, expand the Controllers folder, open TodoItemController.cs and add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, expand the Controllers folder, open TodoItemController.cs and add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: Locate the PostTodoItem method and add the following code at the beginning of the method.
trans-unit.target: Locate the PostTodoItem method and add the following code at the beginning of the method.

trans-unit.source: This code adds the user ID of the authenticated user to the item, before it is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: This code adds the user ID of the authenticated user to the item, before it is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Locate the GetAllTodoItems method and replace the existing return statement with the following line of code:
trans-unit.target: Locate the GetAllTodoItems method and replace the existing return statement with the following line of code:

trans-unit.source: This query filters the returned TodoItem objects so that each user only receives the items that they inserted.
trans-unit.target: This query filters the returned TodoItem objects so that each user only receives the items that they inserted.

trans-unit.source: Republish the mobile service project to Azure.
trans-unit.target: Republish the mobile service project to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Notice that when you now run your client-side app, although there are items already in the database from previous tutorials, no items are returned.
trans-unit.target: Notice that when you now run your client-side app, although there are items already in the database from previous tutorials, no items are returned.

trans-unit.source: This happens because previous items were inserted without the user ID column and now have null values.
trans-unit.target: This happens because previous items were inserted without the user ID column and now have null values.

trans-unit.source: If you have additional login accounts, verify that users can only see their own data by closing and deleting the app and running it again.
trans-unit.target: If you have additional login accounts, verify that users can only see their own data by closing and deleting the app and running it again.

trans-unit.source: When the login credentials dialog is displayed, enter a different login and verify that the items entered under the previous login are not displayed.
trans-unit.target: When the login credentials dialog is displayed, enter a different login and verify that the items entered under the previous login are not displayed.
